data.title: Yum is the word!
data.text: We were driving by and are we ever glad we stopped. First, let's talk about the menu:  choose your fish, then choose your marinade, and then how you want it done.  Wonderful! To add to the enjoyment, awesome onion rings and some of the best chowder.  The staff is friendly and the setting very informal.  If I lived near, I would come here at least twice a week!

data.title: Tacos and beer and wine and easy eating and easy seating.
data.text: Dinner was perfect,  huge tacos for the price, and good prices on the drinks. The line was long and the register was slow however the food and drinks and table and eating was what I was looking for on a Saturday night. Big portions and fresh fish. Food came out quickly as well.

data.title: Fresh and Expensive
data.text: This is one of the BEST fish places to which I have been.  The fish is super fresh and is cooked correctly.  My only complaint is that one must wait in line to order and the prices are very expensive.  The atmosphere is more like a beach-front restaurant but the prices are like an expensive restaurant.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Delicious fresh fish at a reasonable price. Great selection of beer & wine too. I will be back soon.

data.title: Good fish sketchy service
data.text: Great selection of fresh looking fish in the case. You wait in a long line for 20-30 minutes until you reach the cash register to order. Crazy busy kitchen that you can see when you're in line.  You get a number, then you have to hunt down an open table or snag a dirty one and flag down a bus person to clean it off before your food arrives. They are out of silverware and cold glasses for wine or beer...the service is miss or miss, they never seemed to be staffed correctly and hurts service.  Food is good, but can't take the crazy slow service or table fights.

data.title: Very Good All Around
data.text:
Wanted a casual place to stop traveling up the coast and the TA reviews looked good, so we gave a try. 

Very good all around -- excellent fresh fish, nice atmosphere, great service by many different people and decent pricing. 

Would definitely recommend and stop if ever traveling though Encinitas again.

data.title: Fresh Fish... Simple and Delicious
data.text: If you're near Encinitas and looking for fresh seafood this is the place.  Great atmosphere and excellent selection.  Order at the counter... choose your fish and tell them how you'd like it prepared.  I had grilled sea bass with the house seasonings,  a green salad, and side of rice....  perfect!  They also have a good selection of local beers.  Next time I'm visiting I will definitely go back.

data.title: Great Fish is Fresh Fish
data.text: We are visiting from Hawaii and are used to lots of good fresh fish so we had lunch here.  I had grilled yellowtail and my husband had the scallops and both were delicious and fresh.  I wanted something different from what we have in Hawaii so I enjoyed the yellowtail.  The staff is friendly and environment clean.  The only negative was we both really wanted Halibut and it was the only fish they didn't have today!

data.title: Good poke and battered shrimp. Big portions but a bit pricey.
data.text:
Good poke and battered shrimp. Big portions but a bit pricey.

The poke was nicely presented and the seafood was quite fresh. Recommended.

data.title: Fresh and fun
data.text:
We ate here one evening taken by a local and thoroughly enjoyed it.

It's far bring a dressy place - we unusually wore polo shirts and shorts but really liked the fun ambience, nice cold beers and some excellent fish!

The salmon in a teriyaki sauce was particularly good!

data.title: Fresh!!
data.text: Nice setting of tables, self service, the fish is fresh, there is variety, served in sandwich, plate, salad o taco. Recomended

data.title: A Moment in Fish Land
data.text: The Encinitas Fish Shop is located on the infamous restaurant row of HIghway 101, in the city of Encinitas, CA.  Located a stone's throw from several miles of California coast line.  Locals and tourist far and near come here to relax, have a cold drink, and of course partake in a delightful selection of seafood.  One of the pleasing things they do here is allow the customer to decide the item (fish, shellfish, or soup) they want, how it is prepared, and a selection of sides to go with the order.  They serve beer, wine, and soft drinks.  Daily specials are often available so if you don't see it advertised, be sure to ask what it is when you place your order.  Parking is at a premium, so allow some time to find a space.  Seating, like parking is an issue.  They don't have a lot of seating, mainly because of the popularity of the establishment.  Try the Encinitas Fish Shop and spend a moment in fish land.

data.title: Fresh tasty lunch
data.text: With a wide variety of fresh fish and several ways to cook the fish there's something for everyone. The service was quick and friendly.

data.title: Good Fresh Fish
data.text: We went for the dollar oyster happy hour and also had a fish plate.  It was all really good and the service was quick.  We'd go back!

data.title: Good Food
data.text:
Visiting Encinitas, we came here on a recommendation by a local.

Came here two days in a row for dinner after having spent the days at a nearby beach. Five of us ordered a variety of foods including the clam chowder, fish shop chowder, tacos, ahi tuna poke, fresh oysters calamari, sandwiches and fish plates (over the 2 meals!). 

The positives:
Clean restaurant
Fresh fish 
Well-seasoned food
Great tasting
Nice decor
Both open and indoor seating areas
Good variety of fresh oysters

Areas for improvement:
Wait staff and staff taking orders were less than welcoming, impatient and answered questions abruptly. This was a little better on our second night so maybe we caught them on an off-night; not really an excuse though if you're in service industry.

Menu says fish is cooked to medium but on two separate occasions the fish came out overcooked. A fish restaurant should make sure that the food it specializes in is cooked perfectly. 

Side notes: 
Seating is limited!
Thursday is $1/oyster 

Would we go again? Yes, for the variety fish and ways of preparing.

data.title: Fish Fresh and Fantastic
data.text: Finding fresher fish would be a challenge.  The varieties are always plentiful.  It's a favorite for us to introduce friends to and then they can bring their friends.

data.title: I predict this will become a local institution!
data.text: if it's not one already.  2:55 p.m. on a Saturday and people are still streaming in. You can pick your fish, pick your marinade, then pick taco, sandwich, salad, or plate version, and your choice of sides.  Add a local craft beer, wine, or other drink. The fish seems very fresh and you get the feeling you're eating real food. Nutritious and delicious. Our sea bass taco, lobster taco, seaweed salad, and coleslaw were all good enough to order again. Not so much the clam chowder, but I'm a picky New Englander about that. All in all, excellent, and a real addition to Encinitas.

data.title: A huge variety of seafood and beer!
data.text:
Ate here on a Tuesday night while on a work trip.  It took a minute to figure out the proper way to order, but the menu gives you the details.  Pick your fish, pick your seasoning, pick your style.  They have everything from tacos and sandwiches to salads and plate dinners.  I had a TKO taco and a side salad and was more than full.

The atmosphere can be a bit loud, and they do allow dogs on the patio, which is kind of a pet peeve of mine, but oh wells. It was slightly expensive, but I didnt feel like I was gouged.  Tacos were $4 or $5 each depending on the type of fish and my side salad was $5, but it was huge.

data.title: FUN TO DINE THERE - ON TIME TAKE OUT
data.text: The Fish Shop has nice beach vive to it.  Good is good and prices are right. We've done take out and the order has always been ready when promised - a must in my book.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: I had the shrimp and chips. The shrimp were huge, juicy, tasty and cooked to perfection. My husband had the fish and chips. Definitely a place to stop if you are in the area
